result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Selvin A Montes-Dubon

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Defendant Selvin A Montes-Dubon not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
John Vaughn, appeared by video. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's initial appearance. 
The Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant and orders forfeiture of cash bail.
Defendant is to be denied by Public Defender for special bail appearance and must report to the jail for booking.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-24-22 at 1:30 pm in Branch 1.  Previously furnished cash bail is continued with all prior conditions. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Non-appearance by defendant for initial appearance.  Warrant issued on State's motion.
Minutes

$300.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
--Carla Dubon, 940 S. 18th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess fentanyl, possess THC, possess drug paraphernalia and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $300.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with M.A.F., DOB: 02-06-1949, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 09-19-2022
